title: Redaction tests
description: Unit tests for the redaction pipeline: every token listed in OBI_REDACT (including multi-word phrases) is scrubbed from stored transcripts and ledger entries but never from live TUI output; cover overlapping tokens and unicode output.

title: Integration tests w/ fake Codex
description: End-to-end tests that drive Obi against the fake Codex subprocess: verify success flow writes ledger entries, needs_help halts the run, malformed fences produce errors, and transcript redaction only affects stored logs; capture fixture transcripts for regression assertions.

title: Hotkey routing tests
description: Simulate key sequences (pause toggles, hint entry, abort, passthrough typing) against the input router and assert which bytes reach the PTY vs which are consumed by Obi; cover focus changes between hint prompts and normal mode.

title: Parser tests: fenced report
description: Unit tests for the streaming fenced-report parser: noisy prefixes, partial chunks, duplicate fences, UUID mismatch, missing closing fence, and happy-path success with needs_help escalations; ensure parser keeps state across chunk boundaries.

title: Status header data plumbing
description: Wire the TUI header line to live session metadata: epic alias/id, bead id/title, run status (running/success/needs_help), elapsed time, and placeholders for token usage; ensure updates are debounced so frequent PTY events do not cause flicker.

title: Fake Codex harness
description: Deterministic fake Codex subprocess for tests: reads stdin, emits scripted stdout/stderr (noise, prompts, fences), supports scenarios like success, needs_help, malformed fences, and long logs, with configurable exit codes.

title: Obi v2 interactive orchestration
description: Interactive Codex PTY runner, ledger, TUI, redaction, and summarizer for Obi v2.

title: Ledger + resume tests
description: Tests that create temporary ledgers/transcripts, append entries via the new writer, and verify NDJSON validity, append-only semantics, and --resume bead skipping rules (success vs needs_help vs missing report); include simple concurrency guards so multiple runs do not clobber the ledger.
